locale.string: Use the flashlight to shed some light into the dark. Some creatures may not like the light. Take care of the batteries or you will end up in the dark again.
Drink some of this soft drink to restore your health.
This pickaxe is quite heavy. It seems quite strong as if it could break walls.
This choco milk smells slightly sour. This is definitely not the first choice!
This apple has a worm in it. Proteins aren't that bad for you!

The player finds himself in the middle of a maze. Its mission is to escape from this maze alive. It is very dark and difficult to see the path. To shed some light into the darkness a flashlight is located in the inventory of the player which can be accessed with [I]. By clicking on the flashlight, a brief description and a bigger picture of the item is displayed. An item can be dragged into the bottom bar to place it in the player's hand. The inventory be closed by clicking on the [X] in the upper right part of the window or by pressing [I] again. You may activate the previously stored item in the bottom inventory bar with your mouse wheel. Alternatively, the number keys on the keyboard can be used. To use an item click the left mouse button or the button in the inventory. Using the active item will turn the flashlight on and off, consume food or hit something with the pickaxe. With the right mouse button objects can be thrown away.
The player can move forward, to the left, backward and to the right with [W, A, S, D]. With [Ctrl] the player can run, with [Shift] he can sneak with [Spacebar] he can jump and with [Esc] the game can be paused.
On the ground, the player will find other items that he may collect with the left mouse button. To do so, the player has to look at the item and click on the item in a short distance.
While looking for an exit from the maze the player will notice that the walls of the maze move, portals are placed inside the maze that teleport the player into another maze and ghosts that can hurt him but also help him.
There are many different ghosts that differ from each other in their behavior. The player's task is to study this behavior in order to increase his chances to find out of the maze alive. Not every ghosts exists in every maze. Some ghosts can cause severe damage to the player, while others can heal him. Some are afraid of light, while others follow the player.
Have fun with the whims of the ghosts!
